programs.name: Fine Arts
programs.description: The core of all degree programs at the Kunstakademie Düsseldorf is the students' independent artistic activity, guided within classes led by professors. The goal is to cultivate one's own artistic position, personality, and attitude.

programs.name: Art Education
programs.description: Program for secondary and comprehensive schools, incorporating courses in art-related sciences including art history, philosophy, sociology, pedagogy, and didactics.

programs.name: Architecture
programs.description: Postgraduate program supervised by four professors, focusing on architectural design and theory.

Kunstakademie Düsseldorf.description: Founded in 1773, the Kunstakademie Düsseldorf is one of Germany's most prestigious art schools. It has produced numerous influential artists including Joseph Beuys, Gerhard Richter, and Anselm Kiefer. The academy emphasizes independent artistic development within a class-based system led by internationally renowned professors.

programs.name: Fine Arts
programs.description: Comprehensive program covering various aspects of fine arts with emphasis on individual artistic development.

programs.name: Fine Arts
programs.description: Advanced program for developing individual artistic practice and research.

programs.name: Architecture
programs.description: Program focusing on architectural design, theory, and practice.

programs.name: Design
programs.description: Program covering various aspects of design with emphasis on practical and theoretical knowledge.

programs.name: Music
programs.description: Comprehensive music education program with emphasis on performance and theory.

programs.name: Performing Arts
programs.description: Program covering various aspects of performing arts with emphasis on practical and theoretical knowledge.

programs.name: Art Education
programs.description: Program preparing students for teaching art in schools and other educational institutions.

Universität der Künste Berlin.description: The Berlin University of the Arts (UdK Berlin) is one of the largest, most diverse and renowned art colleges in the world. The teaching offered at the four colleges of Fine Art, Design, Music and Performing Arts, as well as at the Central Institute of Further Education, encompasses the full spectrum of the arts and related academic studies in more than 70 courses.

programs.name: Media Art
programs.description: Program focusing on media art with emphasis on practical and theoretical knowledge. The combination of teaching, research, and exhibition institutions addresses the given artistic and pedagogic task of relating traditional arts to media technology and electronic production processes.

programs.name: Product Design
programs.description: Program focusing on product design with emphasis on practical and theoretical knowledge.

programs.name: Communication Design
programs.description: Program focusing on communication design with emphasis on practical and theoretical knowledge.

programs.name: Art Research and Media Philosophy
programs.description: Program focusing on art research and media philosophy with emphasis on theoretical knowledge.

Staatliche Hochschule für Gestaltung Kar.description: Karlsruhe University of Arts and Design was first established as a progressive school on April 15, 1992. It was founded by Heinrich Klotz between the years 1989 and 1992, together with the ZKM | Center for Art and Media Karlsruhe. The combination of teaching, research, and exhibition institutions addresses the given artistic and pedagogic task of relating traditional arts to media technology and electronic production processes.

programs.name: Digitale Medien
programs.description: Program focusing on digital media with emphasis on practical and theoretical knowledge.

programs.name: Digitale Medien
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on digital media with emphasis on research and development.

programs.name: Freie Kunst
programs.description: Program focusing on fine arts with emphasis on individual artistic development.

programs.name: Integriertes Design
programs.description: Program focusing on integrated design with emphasis on practical and theoretical knowledge.

programs.name: Integriertes Design
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on integrated design with emphasis on research and development.

programs.name: Musik
programs.description: Program focusing on music with emphasis on performance and theory.

programs.name: Musik
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on music with emphasis on performance and research.

programs.name: Promotionsprogramm (PhD)
programs.description: Doctoral program focusing on research in arts and design.

Hochschule für Künste Bremen.description: The University of the Arts Bremen (HfK) is a public art college in Bremen, Germany. It was founded in 1873 and offers programs in fine arts, design, digital media, and music. The university is known for its interdisciplinary approach and international orientation.

programs.name: Freie Kunst
programs.description: Comprehensive program in fine arts, covering various disciplines like painting, sculpture, graphic arts, and media art.

programs.name: Architektur
programs.description: Bachelor program focusing on architectural design, theory, and technology.

programs.name: Architektur
programs.description: Master program extending architectural knowledge with focus on design, research, and specialization.

programs.name: Industrial Design
programs.description: Program focusing on the design of industrial products, systems, and services.

programs.name: Industrial Design
programs.description: Advanced program in Industrial Design focusing on innovation, research, and strategic design.

programs.name: Kommunikationsdesign
programs.description: Program covering visual communication across various media.

programs.name: Kommunikationsdesign
programs.description: Advanced program in Communication Design focusing on conceptual development and specialized areas.

programs.name: Textildesign
programs.description: Program focused on the design and creation of textiles for various applications.

programs.name: Textildesign
programs.description: Advanced program in Textile Design focusing on innovation, sustainability, and artistic research.

programs.name: Kunstwissenschaften - Restaurierung
programs.description: Program focusing on the conservation and restoration of art and cultural heritage.

programs.name: Kunstwissenschaften - Restaurierung
programs.description: Advanced program in conservation and restoration, specializing in specific material types.

programs.name: Bühnen- und Kostümbild
programs.description: Program focusing on the design of sets and costumes for theatre, opera, and film.

programs.name: Kunstpädagogik
programs.description: Program preparing students for teaching art at secondary schools (Gymnasium).

Staatliche Akademie der Bildenden Künste.description: The State Academy of Fine Arts Stuttgart (ABK Stuttgart) is one of the oldest and largest art schools in Germany. Founded in 1761, it offers a wide range of programs in fine arts, architecture, design, art education, and conservation.

programs.name: Media Arts
programs.description: Project-based study program focusing on media arts, including film, animation, experimental informatics, sound art, and art history/aesthetics.

programs.name: Media Arts (Postgraduate)
programs.description: Postgraduate program for students with a first degree, focusing on deepening artistic practice in media arts.

Kunsthochschule für Medien Köln.description: The Academy of Media Arts Cologne (KHM) is unique in Germany, offering a project-based 'Media Arts' diploma program that brings together practices from art, film, and theory. It provides resources for independent artistic work across various media forms.

programs.name: Visual Communication
programs.description: Program covering art, electronic media, film, photography, stage/space design, and theory.

programs.name: Product Design
programs.description: Program focusing on integrated design, interface design, materials/technology, and theory.

programs.name: Art Education (Secondary Schools)
programs.description: Teacher training program for art education at secondary schools (Gymnasium).

programs.name: Postgraduate Studies (Meisterschüler)
programs.description: Advanced artistic qualification for graduates of the diploma programs.

programs.name: Doctoral Studies (PhD)
programs.description: Doctoral program in design theory and related fields.

Hochschule für Gestaltung Offenbach.description: The Offenbach University of Art and Design (HfG Offenbach) is a state art college in Hesse, Germany. It offers diploma programs in Visual Communication and Product Design, as well as teacher training and doctoral studies. It emphasizes the integration of theory and practice.

programs.name: Painting/Graphics
programs.description: Focuses on developing individual artistic positions in painting and graphic arts.

programs.name: Book Design/Graphic Design
programs.description: Covers conceptual and practical aspects of book design, typography, illustration, and graphic design.

programs.name: Photography
programs.description: Explores documentary, artistic, and applied photography.

programs.name: Media Art
programs.description: Focuses on time-based media, installation, performance, and net art.

programs.name: Cultures of the Curatorial
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program focusing on curatorial theory and practice.

Hochschule für Grafik und Buchkunst Leip.description: The Academy of Fine Arts Leipzig (HGB) is one of the oldest art schools in Germany. It offers diploma programs in Painting/Graphics, Book Design/Graphic Design, Photography, and Media Art, as well as a Master's program in Cultures of the Curatorial.

programs.name: Fine Arts
programs.description: Studio-based program covering painting, sculpture, ceramics, and media art.

programs.name: Fine Arts
programs.description: Advanced program for deepening individual artistic practice.

programs.name: Communication Design
programs.description: Covers graphic design, typography, illustration, interaction design, and photography.

programs.description: Advanced program focusing on conceptual and strategic communication design.

programs.name: Industrial Design
programs.description: Focuses on product design, interface design, and design theory.

programs.name: Industrial Design
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on strategic design, innovation, and sustainability.

programs.name: Spatial Strategies
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program focusing on the design of spaces, exhibitions, and scenography.

Muthesius Kunsthochschule Kiel.description: The Muthesius University of Fine Arts and Design in Kiel is the only art university in Schleswig-Holstein. It offers Bachelor's and Master's programs in Fine Arts, Communication Design, Industrial Design, and Spatial Strategies.

programs.name: Fine Art
programs.description: Studio-based program focusing on contemporary art practices.

programs.name: Fine Art
programs.description: Advanced program for developing individual artistic positions and research.

programs.name: Product Design
programs.description: Focuses on the design of products, systems, and interactions.

programs.name: Product Design
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on design research, innovation, and sustainability.

programs.name: Visual Communication
programs.description: Covers graphic design, typography, photography, illustration, and interaction design.

programs.name: Visual Communication
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on conceptual and experimental visual communication.

programs.name: Media Art and Design
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program exploring artistic practices with digital and electronic media.

Bauhaus-Universität Weimar.description: The Bauhaus-Universität Weimar is a university located in Weimar, Germany, specializing in the artistic and technical fields. Established in 1860 as the Great Ducal Saxon Art School, it gained collegiate status on 3 June 1910. In 1919 the school was renamed Bauhaus by its new director Walter Gropius and it received its present name in 1996.

programs.name: Fine Arts
programs.description: Studio-based program in painting, sculpture, and interdisciplinary art.

programs.name: Art Education
programs.description: Preparation for teaching art in schools and cultural institutions.

Alanus Hochschule für Kunst und Gesellsc.description: Alanus University of Arts and Social Sciences is a private university in Alfter, near Bonn. It offers programs in fine arts, art education, and social sciences, with a focus on interdisciplinary and practice-oriented learning.

programs.name: Fine Arts
programs.description: Focus on contemporary artistic practice in painting, sculpture, and media art.

Hochschule der bildenden Künste Essen.description: The Hochschule der bildenden Künste Essen is a young art academy in the Ruhr area, offering programs in fine arts with a focus on contemporary artistic practice.

programs.name: Media Design
programs.description: Covers graphic design, animation, and digital media production.

Hochschule Macromedia.description: Hochschule Macromedia is a private university of applied sciences with campuses in several German cities, offering programs in media, design, and communication.

programs.name: Design, Art and Media
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program in design, art, and media theory and practice.

Merz Akademie.description: Merz Akademie is a university of applied sciences for design, art, and media in Stuttgart, offering interdisciplinary programs with a focus on creative and critical thinking.

programs.name: Film and Television
programs.description: Covers directing, screenwriting, cinematography, and production for film and television.

Hochschule für Fernsehen und Film Münche.description: The University of Television and Film Munich (HFF München) is one of the most renowned film schools in Germany, offering programs in film and television production, directing, and screenwriting.

programs.name: Film Directing
programs.description: Comprehensive program in film directing for feature, documentary, and television.

programs.name: Screenwriting/Dramaturgy
programs.description: Focuses on writing for film, television, and new media.

programs.name: Animation
programs.description: Covers animation for film, television, and interactive media.

programs.name: Cinematography
programs.description: Program in camera work, lighting, and visual storytelling for film and television.

programs.name: Film and Television Production
programs.description: Focuses on producing for film, television, and digital media.

programs.name: Sound
programs.description: Covers sound design, recording, and mixing for film and media.

programs.name: Editing
programs.description: Program in film and video editing, post-production, and storytelling.

programs.name: Media Studies
programs.description: Research-oriented program in film, media, and cultural studies.

Filmuniversität Babelsberg KONRAD WOLF.description: Filmuniversität Babelsberg KONRAD WOLF is Germany's oldest and largest film university, located in Potsdam-Babelsberg. It offers a wide range of programs in film, television, animation, production, and media studies, combining artistic practice with academic research. The university is renowned for its close ties to the film industry and its international collaborations.

programs.name: Interaktionsgestaltung
programs.description: Focuses on interaction design, user experience, and digital product development.

programs.name: Kommunikationsgestaltung
programs.description: Covers communication design, visual communication, and media design.

programs.name: Produktgestaltung
programs.description: Focuses on product design, industrial design, and innovation.

programs.name: Strategische Gestaltung
programs.description: Advanced program in strategic design, design management, and innovation.

Hochschule für Gestaltung Schwäbisch Gmü.description: The Hochschule für Gestaltung Schwäbisch Gmünd (HfG Schwäbisch Gmünd) is a renowned university of design in Baden-Württemberg, Germany. It offers bachelor's and master's programs in interaction design, communication design, product design, and strategic design, with a strong focus on practical, interdisciplinary, and innovative approaches to design education. The university is known for its close ties to industry and its international orientation.

programs.name: Humanities, the Arts, and Social Thought
programs.description: Interdisciplinary liberal arts program focusing on critical thinking, textual analysis, and engagement with foundational works in philosophy, literature, art history, and social theory. Taught in small, seminar-style classes.

programs.name: Economics, Politics, and Social Thought
programs.description: Program examining the intersections of economic, political, and social theories and practices. Taught in small, seminar-style classes.

Bard College Berlin.description: Bard College Berlin is a private, non-profit liberal arts college in Berlin, Germany, offering intensive, English-taught Bachelor of Arts degrees in Humanities, the Arts, and Social Thought, and in Economics, Politics, and Social Thought. It emphasizes small seminar-style classes, critical thinking, and close engagement with core texts and ideas. It is part of the Bard College network.

programs.name: Visual Arts
programs.description: Program in visual arts, focusing on painting, drawing, sculpture, and new media.

programs.name: Communication Design
programs.description: Program focused on graphic design, typography, illustration, and digital communication.

Academy of Visual Arts Frankfurt.description: The Academy of Visual Arts Frankfurt is a private, state-recognized academy in Hesse, Germany. It offers Bachelor of Arts programs in Visual Arts and Communication Design, emphasizing both classical techniques and contemporary practices. The academy provides a practice-oriented education with individual support in small classes.

programs.name: Interface Design
programs.description: Program in interface design, user experience, interaction design, and digital media.

programs.name: Communication Design
programs.description: Program focusing on visual communication, graphic design, typography, and illustration.

programs.name: Product Design
programs.description: Program in product design, industrial design, and sustainable design practices.

programs.name: European Media Studies (with University of Potsdam)
programs.description: Interdisciplinary MA program focusing on media culture, theory, and analysis in a European context, offered jointly with the University of Potsdam.

Fachhochschule Potsdam.description: Fachhochschule Potsdam (FHP) is a university of applied sciences in Brandenburg, known for its strong design department and practice-oriented education. It offers a variety of programs in interface design, communication design, product design, and European media studies, emphasizing interdisciplinary projects, innovation, and social responsibility. The university has close ties to cultural institutions and the media industry in the Berlin-Brandenburg metropolitan region.

programs.name: Media and Communication
programs.description: Program in media, communication, and digital culture, with a focus on journalism, PR, and digital storytelling.

programs.name: Animation and Game
programs.description: Practice-oriented program in animation, game design, and interactive media.

programs.name: Motion Pictures
programs.description: Covers film, television, and digital video production, including directing, editing, and production management.

programs.name: Communication Design
programs.description: Program in visual communication, graphic design, and branding.

programs.name: Expanded Realities
programs.description: Advanced program in virtual, augmented, and mixed reality for media and design professionals.

programs.name: Interactive Media Design
programs.description: Focuses on interactive design, user experience, and digital product development.

Hochschule Darmstadt.description: Hochschule Darmstadt (h_da) is one of Germany's leading universities of applied sciences, located in Hesse. It is renowned for its innovative programs in media, animation, communication design, and interactive media. The university offers a wide range of bachelor's and master's degrees, combining creative practice with technical expertise and strong industry connections. Its graduates are highly regarded in the creative industries, especially in animation, film, and digital media.

programs.name: Design and Communication
programs.description: Program in design, communication, and digital media, with a strong focus on international collaboration and interdisciplinary projects.

programs.name: Media Communication and Computer Science
programs.description: Combines media studies, communication, and computer science for careers in digital media and IT.

programs.name: International Relations
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program in international relations, politics, and communication.

programs.name: Sustainable Design
programs.description: Advanced program in sustainable design, innovation, and environmental communication.

Hochschule Rhein-Waal.description: Hochschule Rhein-Waal is a young, innovative university of applied sciences with a strong international orientation. It offers a wide range of English-taught programs in design, communication, media, computer science, and environmental sciences. The university is known for its interdisciplinary approach, modern campus, and focus on sustainability and global collaboration.

programs.name: Media Technology
programs.description: Comprehensive program in media technology, digital systems, creative engineering, and interactive systems.

programs.name: Human-Computer Interaction
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on the design, development, and evaluation of interactive systems and user experiences.

programs.name: Design and Computation
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program merging design with computational methods for innovative solutions in architecture, media, and art.

programs.name: Audiovisual Media Culture and Communication
programs.description: Focuses on theoretical and practical aspects of audiovisual media, communication, and cultural studies.

Technische Universität Berlin.description: Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin) is one of Germany's largest and most internationally renowned technical universities. It offers a wide range of programs with a strong emphasis on research and innovation, particularly in engineering, computer science, and technology-driven arts and media. Its media-related programs are known for their interdisciplinary approach and focus on cutting-edge research in areas like human-computer interaction and design computation.

programs.name: Design (Integrated Design)
programs.description: Comprehensive program in design, visual communication, and digital media, with a strong connection to the Bauhaus tradition in Dessau.

programs.name: Design (Master)
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on interdisciplinary design projects, research, and innovation.

programs.name: Architecture (Dessau International Architecture Graduate School - DIA)
programs.description: International master's program in architecture with a focus on design, theory, and research, based at the historic Bauhaus campus.

Hochschule Anhalt.description: Hochschule Anhalt is a university of applied sciences located in Saxony-Anhalt, with a significant design department in Dessau, the heart of the Bauhaus movement. It offers a range of programs in design, visual communication, and architecture, emphasizing practical education, interdisciplinary projects, and the rich heritage of Bauhaus design principles. The Dessau International Architecture Graduate School (DIA) is a notable part of its offerings.

programs.name: Media Studies
programs.description: Program in media studies, communication, digital culture, and media history.

programs.name: Media Studies
programs.description: Advanced research-oriented program in media theory, analysis, and digital media practices.

programs.name: Digital Humanities
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program combining humanities research with computational methods and digital technologies.

Universität Trier.description: The University of Trier, one of Germany's oldest universities, re-established in 1970, is a public research university in Rhineland-Palatinate. It offers a strong profile in humanities, social sciences, and law, with notable programs in media studies, communication, and digital humanities. The university is situated in a city with a rich Roman history, influencing its cultural and historical research focus.

programs.name: Media Studies
programs.description: Program in media studies, communication, digital culture, and media practice.

programs.name: Media Studies
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on media theory, research methods, and specialized media topics.

programs.name: Human Computer Interaction
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program on the design and evaluation of interactive systems, user experience, and digital innovation.

Universität Siegen.description: The University of Siegen is a public research university in North Rhine-Westphalia, known for its interdisciplinary approach and strong focus on media studies, human-computer interaction, and social sciences. It offers a range of programs in these fields, often combining theoretical knowledge with practical application and research.

programs.name: Design and User Experience
programs.description: Focus on design, usability, and user experience in digital products, with strong industry links and practical projects.

programs.name: User Experience Design
programs.description: Advanced program in user experience, usability engineering, and digital innovation.

programs.name: Mobility and Transportation Design
programs.description: Program in mobility, transportation, and automotive design.

Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt.description: Technische Hochschule Ingolstadt (THI) is a leading university of applied sciences in Bavaria, known for its innovative programs in design, user experience, mobility, and engineering. The university emphasizes practical training, research, and strong industry partnerships, preparing students for careers in digital product design, mobility, and user experience.

programs.name: Interactive Media
programs.description: Program in interactive media, design, and digital communication, with a focus on interdisciplinary teamwork and digital innovation.

programs.name: Communication Design
programs.description: Program in communication design, graphic design, and visual communication.

programs.name: Interactive Media Systems
programs.description: Advanced program in interactive media, digital systems, and user experience.

Technische Hochschule Augsburg.description: Technische Hochschule Augsburg (THA) is a dynamic university of applied sciences in Bavaria, offering innovative programs in interactive media, communication design, and digital systems. The university is known for its interdisciplinary approach, strong industry links, and focus on digital transformation and creative industries.

programs.name: Media and Communication
programs.description: Program in media studies, communication science, digital culture, and media economics.

programs.name: Media and Communication
programs.description: Advanced program focusing on media research, strategic communication, and media management.

programs.name: Digital Humanities
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program combining humanities with computer science methods for digital text analysis and cultural data.

Universität Passau.description: The University of Passau is a public research university in Bavaria, known for its strong international focus and interdisciplinary programs in law, business, humanities, and computer science. Its media and communication programs integrate theoretical knowledge with practical skills, often exploring the impact of digitalization on society and culture.

programs.name: Media Communication
programs.description: Program in media, communication, digital culture, and media psychology.

programs.name: Media Communication
programs.description: Advanced program in media research, communication strategies, and media effects.

programs.name: Human-Computer Systems
programs.description: Focuses on the design, development, and evaluation of interactive computer systems, bridging psychology and computer science.

Universität Würzburg.description: The Julius-Maximilians-Universität Würzburg, founded in 1402, is one of Germany's oldest and most traditional universities. It offers a broad range of disciplines, including humanities, medicine, natural sciences, and technology. Its programs in media communication and human-computer systems combine strong theoretical foundations with research-oriented and applied projects.

programs.name: Media Informatics
programs.description: Program in media informatics, digital media, and communication technology, with a strong research focus and international collaborations.

programs.name: Media Informatics
programs.description: Advanced program in media informatics, digital media, and interactive systems.

programs.name: Communication Engineering
programs.description: Program in communication engineering, digital networks, and media technology.

RWTH Aachen University.description: RWTH Aachen University is one of Europe's leading technical universities, renowned for its research and teaching in engineering, media informatics, and digital media. The university offers a wide range of bachelor's and master's programs, with a strong focus on innovation, internationalization, and industry collaboration.

programs.name: Media Engineering
programs.description: Program in media engineering, digital technology, creative industries, and media systems.

programs.name: Informatics: Games Engineering
programs.description: Specialized informatics program focusing on game development, computer graphics, and simulation.

programs.name: Computational Science and Engineering
programs.description: Interdisciplinary program focused on computational methods in science and engineering, applicable to media, design, and simulation.

programs.name: Management and Technology (with focus on Digital Technologies)
programs.description: Combines management studies with a deep understanding of technology, including digital media and innovation.

Technische Universität München.description: The Technical University of Munich (TUM) is one of Europe's leading research universities, consistently ranked among the top universities globally. It excels in engineering, natural sciences, life sciences, medicine, and management. TUM offers innovative programs at the intersection of technology and creative fields, such as Games Engineering and Computational Science, fostering a strong entrepreneurial spirit and close ties with industry.
